1$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/19/2019 7:25:12 PM$Reviewer: Hurt
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $1$1$1$"I was diagnosed as ADHD in 4th grade and prescribed Ritalin
column3: 6th grade they saw it wasn't working and they prescribed me Adderall 2 pills in the morning 2 pills by lunch I went from to energetic to sleep in every class... But because i had to urinate all the time after i started the medicine some time I'd be so sleep I'd dream i was in a restroom urinating and the warm sensation of peeing on myself would wake me up to a class room of embarrassment. My throat muscles stopped working so i couldn't eat breakfast lunch or after school only intake liquid (parents cook and don't understand that i literally couldn't swallow my food
column4: whooped or screamed wasting food {but i would be hungry}). From time to time i would  stand up and everything would look like a frying TV channel (Black white and gray dots is all i would see scared i was going blind
column5: still happens now). I would get random rashes that would start looking like a ant bite and spread till it vanised i thought it was something wrong with me so i separated my self fell deep into depression until i dropped out of school 2007 and stopped taking the medicine. After about 6 years those rashes slowed down still stuggle eating socially awkward (don't know how to handle socializing at work) still have to urinate every 20-30 min (interferes with my jobs to many breaks) i was a kid whos school had my mom put me on the medicine i didn't pay for it but i was a kid effected by the medicine and the #LABEL of ADHD and the #Process of #ADHD

column1: 3$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/6/2018 2:09:38 AM$Reviewer: MrCook
column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I struggled to concentrate my whole life. I was called a ""high aptitude/low achiever"". ""If he would just buckle down and do the work...his mind wanders...he refuses to get his work done. He's unprepared...he always has an excuse... He's disorganized."" I heard these comments from everyone. I frustrated my teachers
column3: my parents and myself. I couldn't pay attention. School was a nightmare that seemed to last forever. I couldn't wait for each class to end. Yet I would do well on tests. I'd get terrible grades for class participation and homework assignments
column4: but then I would get an A or a B on midterms and finals and end up with a B or a C in the course. In college I discovered amphetamines
column5: which are much stronger than Adderall but had the same effect on my ability to concentrate. I'd be failing a course all semester
column6: skipping classes
column7: losing my homework
column8: etc.
column9: but then I'd get some ""speed"" and learn the entire course from the book in a couple of days and ace the final. I was accused of cheating once because professor didn't believe I could have learned so much in such a short period. I was self-medicating
column10: but I didn't know it. There was no such thing as ADD or ADHD in the 60's and 70'. I thought there was something wrong with me and I was wrong to take amphetamines. I couldn't take them all the time; the side effects were extreme. After college
column11: I had to accept mediocrity in almost everything
column12: but I got by. At 50
column13: a shrink finally recognized my ADHD and prescribed Adderall. One of the best days of my life. No more antidepressants
column14: no more confusion and no more procrastination and mediocre achievement. The fog had lifted. My life is so much better in every way. I've learned to accept that where I am today is the culmination of everything I've ever done. I can't regret that because I am happier now than I've ever been. Medical science has saved me. My newfound ability to think and act rationally has made it so I can help others through this sometimes confusing life.

5$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/13/2018 7:49:21 PM$Reviewer: Darby1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was misdiagnosed for the first 17 years of my life
column2: I was forced to take antidepressants that scared me and didn't work. I failed at everything. I would have emotional outbursts from being so overwhelmed. I saw so many doctors and counselors I felt like I was broken and no one was able to ""fix"" me. As I grew up I learned ways to manage my symptoms but it was exhausting. If i was succeeding at any point it always ended with failure or side tracked resulting in countless unfinished things that made me feel incompetent. ""Jack of all trades; master at none"". I knew I was capable of so much more but the distractions of hearing
column3: seeing
column4: feeling
column5: smelling everything in my environment all at the same time made me dizzy and I couldn't sort it all out. It wasnt until a little over a year ago I began therapy
column6: seeing a wonderful Psychiatrist who UNDERSTOOD ME! For the first time in my life i was reassured i wasnt alone. Apprehensively I began taking this medicine
column7: it took over 6 months to start feeling in control of my mind
column8: but now I have it figured out. Instead of hearing music
column9: I am listening to the instruments. I can single out the drummer and follow his beats to the end. I am maintaining a high GPA in college
column10: I am organized
column11: efficient and I no longer feel like a crack in the sidewalk of life. I hate that people without a diagnosis
column12: who aren't struggling are abusing this medicine that helps so many people function at high capacity who truly need it! The biggest draw back for me is seeing what I could've done years ago but didn't. I have noticed my heart rate goes up spontaneously which can be scary
column13: but it does pass. I have to learn to give myself credit for my successes
column14: I am not my medication or ADHD but they have both added to the positives of who I am. If you have been struggling
column15: reach out!"

As in I would take it and when I would be off it I would feel like there was a completely different person who acted in place of me.

column1: 7$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/24/2018 6:22:44 AM$Reviewer: CLBK
column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I was fortunate to have a Doctor that asked questions and diagnosed me in my 40's. If I had been diagnosed earlier my life would have been better. I take Adderall 30 mg XL capsules and it changed my life. I feel normal! For my treatment this form and dosage works great. I take it about an hour before I'll be getting up and I'm able to function and stay focused at my job and at home. It doesn't make me jittery or hyper
column3: doesn't take my appetite away ( I often wish it would!) I still occasionally need a nap during the day and have no problem falling asleep at night. I've always had low blood pressure
column4: low body temperature
column5: and low blood sugar but they tell me my thyroid levels are fine. I used to get a lot of migraines and had to have Imitrex Nasal with me all the time. Now I very seldom need it. For me personally Adderall has been a life saver! I take it as directed
column6: don't abuse it
column7: see my doctor regularly and can live a productive life. I've been on it for about ten years now
column8: I'm female and 60 years old.

column1: 8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/4/2018 9:30:37 PM$Reviewer: Ize
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Made college a possibility for me. I was able to focus and perform well in my classes. Before that I had been failing but knew I could do more than my grades were showing. Over the years (17 or so I believe) I have remained on the same dose with no side effects. I have since been promoted at work and although I am struggling to learn time management on a whole new level I suspect that is normal and not due to ADHD. I continue to take my medication to maintain a level of ""normal"" cognative function like everyone else. Otherwise everything that crossed my mind would cross my lips and I couldn't keep my emotions in check. I would easily be overwhelmed by projects or anything that involved multiple steps and people depending on me. I would wilt under the pressure. Adderall allows me the ability to focus my thoughts and slow my mental process down. Filter the thousand bits of input I'm bombardrd with every moment. I can see the forrest through the leaves... This medication has been pivotal to my success and I was able to stop taking antidepressants after being on Adderall. I finally felt normal. Hopefully my review helps put a parent at ease when considering if they should put their child on Adderall or not. "

column1: 12$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/30/2017 3:22:35 AM$Reviewer: Almost20yrsTakingAdderall
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Adderall makes me feel normal.

column1: Without it I space out
column2: have trouble prioritizing and getting around to doing what I need to do
column3: and can't function as an adult. Before I started taking it I would pick fights (arguments) in order to get my adrenalin to go up so I could do things. Now I'm even-keeled all day long (and have learnt to space out dosage through the day in order to be even-keeled).

column1: I never take more than what I've been prescribed (60mg) and depending on the day I can function well on as little as 40mg.  This blue pill has changed my life. I've been on the same prescription for almost 20 years now.
I once took too much and felt bad but it didn't feel like a ""high"".  If I wanted to get high Aderall would be the last thing I would take
column2: because all it does is to make me normal.

column1: Note I have the Inactive diagnosis of ADHD meaning I was never hyperactive. I retreated into my inner world and spaced out instead.
Hope this helps others like me.

20$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/16/2016 5:42:21 PM$Reviewer: Momof3, 25-34 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$3$BEWARE!! This medicine is dangerous!! I was a 20mg of Addreal once a day for five years and it worked with no problems.  Within those five years I got pregnant and when off my meds during pregnancy. Two months After the birth of my last child, I re-started my medicine and for some reason it didn't help as it did before. So I self-Medicaid, and take another pill.... Long story short, I became  dependent on the medication and could not go without it. I very quickly became addicted and started taking more and more. My mood changed, I was very   Aggressive and mean always yelling at my family my children would be scared of me I would lose my temper very quickly. Also This lead to no sleep, not eating, I became too thin, my hair started to fall out and became very thin and stringy. My husband didn't know what to think, and I became someone I didn't even know. I almost got my children taken away and a divorce.... Mortal of the story it changed my life upside down and I had to stop taking it!!! I have been working with my doctors and now I'm on vyvanse along with depression medicine and it works great!! Not addicting at all and helps me get my daily tasks done, care for my family and I'm finally getting back to myself :)

25$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/1/2016 12:33:18 PM$Reviewer: Smalloni, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $3$1$1$My son was changed from Ritalin to Adderall at age 13. After a short while of being on Adderall he became very angry and defiant. We thought that since he was going through puberty & dealing with ADHD that he was just having a rough time dealing with the chemistry changing in his body. As time went on he became more aggressive threatening to stab his father with a butcher knife & constantly going up against his dad & peers at school. He distroyed things in his path & punched holes in the walls of our home, yelling & cursing when anyone rubbed him the wrong way. The slightest things would set him off into fits of rage. He took on multiple personalities one being very evil as if Satan's son. He was a Jeckyll & Hyde.  This went on for 4 years as the dosage was increased because of his high tolerance to Adderall. After being in support groups & reading up I discovered other we're experiencing these very same side affects. I demanded the doctor to take him off of it and since he's been off of it for 6 months now & almost instantly I got my sweet boy back. I read that Adderall was like taking crystal meth. This medicine needs to be removed from the market permanently in my opinion. He was in & out of the hospital 4 times in a 3 months time frame. Not once had the doctors ever try taking him off the Adderall. All they did was ginnea pig him pumping him full of antipsychotic meds. He ended up for the first time in his life getting in trouble with the police for assault on an officer, resisting arrest & interfering with police business. Adderall is a very dangerous medication. If you benefit from it without the bad side affects, then that is good. If not, I would not take this medication.

29$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/6/2016 11:21:36 PM$Reviewer: brooke26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking Adderall for over about 17 years. Without this medication I would never have graduated high school
column2: college
column3: and be working on my second degree. Sometimes medication is the only option for those who try everything possible first. This drug is nothing to play with
column4: it takes precise clock work
column5: discipline and knowledge. You have to ensure you are keeping your body healthy when taking it. Yes
column6: it does have side effects but yes it does work great for those who need this type of chemical balance. If you want to prevent the ""rush"" as some report
column7: EAT first. Then
column8: make sure you drink more than the minimum amount of water a day. I literally drink about 10 waters a day. Stay away from caffeine and make sure to NEVER take this med. at night unless you don't plan on sleeping
column9: which is another thing to make sure you are getting enough of. A balanced diet
column10: sleep
column11: and overall life routine is important. I also wouldn't recommend you take it if you are going to a social event
column12: because like me I'm not the socialist butterfly on it when I would normally talk an ear off. With proper care and balance this is the answer for most. It is my answer and I'm more than thankful I have gotten as far as I have and I am thankful for its creation. I hope this helps some and also to the mothers
column13: when your child is on this med. it's best to leave them alone. They just want to focus and most likely won't want to eat. It's just how it made me and when they are ""coming down"" they will need something to pick them up..it's a horrible crash on the XR(extended release caps 8hr). I usually drink a soda or a coffee. Sometimes I will even take a 1/2 of my instant release(4 hr tabs) if I have school work still to help ease the crashing. Lots of water to prevent headaches and time the pills. I don't get the full 8 hours that some would
column14: I'm about 4 hours and I begin to fade. My doctor has me prescribed 1 8hr cap in am(7am) and then by 12pm one 4hrtab
column15: 4pm one 4hrtab. single mom so long day"

column1: 35$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/22/2015 11:26:40 AM$Reviewer: joeo

column4: but I still couldn't sleep. It was not helping me concentrate and put me in a terrible mood. I went back to my psychiatrist and was prescribed adderall xr generic brand by Barr. It's amazing ! It's puts me in a great mood

column6: and I'm not experiencing many side effects. Only thing I notice is it doesn't really last as long as it's suppose to. I work in a fast paced environment and I'm constantly running around dealing with patients which speeds up my metabolism and makes it wear off pretty fast. I got home and was ready to sleep
column7: but here it is 2:10 am and I'm up reading on side effects lol. So besides the lack of sleep and appetite loss it's awesome so far !!

92$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/20/2014 10:00:56 PM$Reviewer: Alex, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was on Strattera for about 5 years and switching to adderall has been one of the best decisions i've made. Adderall is essentially like taking 10 red bulls. It can work for longer periods, but the biggest bonus is the quality of work that I can produce. The reason being, adderall gives me the ability to be able to be much more focused on the material and as a result, I retain it better. There is a downside however. If taken too late in the day, it can keep you awake and sometimes you can feel a bit overstimulated. Another thing to watch for may be a slight change in behaviour. I had family members that hadn't seen me in several months tell me that I seemed too stimulated during regular conversation. In terms of dosage, I personally found 20mg to be more than enough but this varies from person to person. Overall my experience has been great, it has helped me bridge that gap that has kept me from performing like the rest of the students in my classes.

column1: I had major issues staying focused and awake no matter how much sleep I would get. I would get bored easily or start a dozen different tasks and not get one completed. I had no time management.
I started with 20mg and I take it in the am when I wake up at 6 am. It makes me want to do my job and not get stressed. I am much more
organized. It keeps my life on track.
I started getting headaches about 3 months in and just really tired again by 3 pm. When I went to my dr for a check up she decided to
try a half of a 20mg of plain adderall at 2pm.
It did the trick and I've been on this combination ever since and haven't had to change anything.
I go to bed by 10:30 or 11 pm. I hardly ever have trouble sleeping.  My heart doesn't race either.
A plus for me was it helped lose the weight from having my daughter a few years prior. I gained 70lbs and wasn't worried about losing
the last 30lbs but it was an added plus.
I don't have such an appetite loss like I did when I first started.
It helps me with portion control and I don't stuff my face like I used to before I started the medication.
It also helps me have normal bowel movements and regular.
I will tell you if I have to stay up later I do end up irritable and get quiet and just want to crash. That's about the only side effect I've experienced.

column1:
110$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/22/2014 10:17:58 AM$Reviewer: AdderallForADHD, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$2$I gave this medication a 2 out of 5 for Ease of Use because I have had a few issues with dosage size and perscription. When I lost a significant amount of weight (due to health changes - NOT the medication), my Dr. thought it might be best to alter my medication system, and for the next year my dose and brand was shuffled around, as a result every pharmacist in town thinks I am some cartel drug dealer. But once on the right dose for your body, Adderall is incredible for those with Attention Deficit. It will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. I can generally think much more clearly and am able to multi-task. If you need Adderall, it will work for you and you will NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. The medication for someone with ADHD will slow you, in a sense: making it clear and possible to make simple, rational decisions without struggle and giving you the ability to channel your energy and focus on what you need. I take 2 25mg XRs throughout the day, and have an optional add on of 10mg instant release for if I have a lot of homework or my XR wears off (I am a student, and mostly use the extra during exams or if I am writing a last minute essay the night before). I am an 18y/o 115 lb girl and pretty skinny, and this is the dose that works well for me (it deffinately isn't the same for everyone). The only problem I have found with Adderall is that on nights I take the optional 10mg, I have some trouble sleeping. But it's alright, because I don't take it often and usually if I do I need to stay awake that night anyways. However, if you do not have to pull frequent all-nighters, I would recommend never taking Adderall within  4 hours of your bedtime. Other than that, Adderall has provided me with the ability to focus in class, on my friends, after school, and accomplish the things I need to do, without ever getting too distracted or forgetting what I had to do.

121$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/17/2014 12:18:10 AM$Reviewer: adderall593, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$1$Please practice extreme caution when using this drug.  The first time I used it I became hooked and went to the doctor to get a prescription right away.  It was not long after that I developed a dependence that turned into an addiction, and an inability to do anything while off of the drug.  I started at 20 mg, and three years later, have to take 40-60mg to get the same effects, but the side effects are completely dreadful....intense mood swings, depression, insomnia, etc.  I just did not feel like myself, but it was still so hard to stop taking the drug.  I still take it once in a while because I have a rigorous class schedule and studying without it is almost impossible.  I am definitely a different person when I'm on it and feel that it has brought more negative than positive experiences into my life. Although not all people will have negative experiences and/or become addicted, this drug can ruin your life.

154$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/4/2013 2:16:09 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$My doctor treated me with the usual anti-depressants - Prozac
column2: Paxil
column3: Lexapro
column4: Klonopin
column5: etc for depression
column6: confusion
column7: lack of self worth
column8: crying.  Finally
column9: my Pain Management doctor
column10: who maintains my drug infusion pump gave me a prescription for Adderall XR.  I immediately noticed an improvement in my mental state.  I had more energy
column11: felt more stable
column12: better concentration
column13: even more able to deal with my chronic pain.  I started on 10 Mg daily and increased over time.  I am now on 40 mg XR daily.  I am certain that I could use another increase
column14: but I prefer stay as low as possible for as long as possible.  I will say that this has been the absolute best medication I have ever been on and the only one that dealt effectively with my depression.  I have never been able to deal with life in such a positive
column15: focused  and calm manner.  I hope I never have to stop taking this medication.  Even my Psychiatrist has noticed the difference in me and he recommends that I continue on this medication.  He said he is willing to prescribe it for me if there should ever be a reason I stop requiring the services of the doctor who prescribes it for me now.  I have been under treatment with the same psychiatrist for 12 years and he agrees that this medicine has been the best prescription for improving my depression and dealing with other very complicated issues in my life.  So
column16: for right now
column17: he says continue the good work and he is very pleased that I have found the correct medication. Over the course of therapy
column18: I have gone from 6 different medications a day down to 2.  I also still take .05 Klonopin at night
column20: for anxiety.  I am happy to say that I have never felt better.  I do realize this is an addictive drug
column22: it is also a necessary drug for some people and I am one of them.

I like the long lasting version better. There are good and bad effects from the medicine. The good is that you get things done, even if you don't want to. It also suppresses my appetite which is good as I tend to overeat. The bad effects: sometimes I hyper focus or focus too much on the wrong things like playing video games on my ipad or phone. Also, it used to make me want to smoke cigarettes for some reason. I have quit, but I do use e cigs sometimes. Also, I tend to pick at my skin if I am really tired and have taken Adderall. I don't notice a come down most of the time as other people have mentioned. One last thing. I forget that I need to drink water while taking Adderall, because I never get thirsty while on Adderall which is odd. But if I don't hydrate myself, I end up getting a headache .

column1: 197$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/11/2013 10:25:56 AM$Reviewer: Thankful
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I came to this site today to review opinions between ""Brand"" and generic Adderrall and thought I should add my personal experience with this medication.

column1: I was diagnosed with depression 14 years ago and was prescribed Paxil. After six months of little change in my condition
column2: I was prescribed Prozac and Xanax. Over the next few years
column3: my conditioned worsened. I was eventually prescribed Ambien for insomnia
column4: which was a huge mistake.

column1: I became addicted to Ambien
column2: not for the sleep benefits but for the Utopian feeling it provided me. I would take it several times during the day
column3: and quickly began running out of my prescriptions. This led to ""Doc Shopping
column4: and eventually I had three doctors writing me scripts every month.

column1: Long story short: my marriage fell apart
column2: I couldn't hold a job and I reached a point where I didn't care whether I lived or died.

column1: Three years ago
column2: I made an appt. with a young doctor at a university research facility. After describing my medical history and my current condition
column3: he said he believed I suffered from adult ADD. He started me on 10 mg of Adderall daily.

column1: Within two months
column2: I was completely off my depression meds (Cymbalta and Tofrenil) and had no desire whatsoever for the Ambien.

column1: I have now been taking 30 mg daily for the past year
column2: and am experiencing no addictive drug behavior whatsoever. I was also a daily drinker
column3: and now only drink 1-2 glasses of wine on the weekends. I have held a steady
column4: professional-level job for over three years now
column5: and my marriage has been restored.

column1: Through the grace of God
column2: I was led to a doctor who literally saved my life. This amazing drug has helped make all the difference. If you have been diagnosed with depression and nothing seems to help
column3: you may want to discuss this with your doctor."

228$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/13/2013 9:08:03 AM$Reviewer: Horrible for Family,Awesome for Business, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$I worked my way up to 60-80mg daily for the year I took adderall. It was alot like making a deal with the devil.  YOU WILL BE SUCCESSFUL AT WHAT YOU DO.  YOU WILL GET ADDICTED.  It will stop working the same and u will not get the benifits u once received.  Coming down is not fun.  I started drinking everynight to even out my moods at night.  If not I would get very aggitated and angry.  I made well over a million dollars in the last year, but every emotional/personal issue took a back seat.  Do not take Adderall if you have a family.  You will regret it.

231$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 12:39:46 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$2$5$I only took adderall for about four months before I had to stop. It worked wonders of my focus is school and controlled my hyperactivity really well for the most part, but the side effects were just too much. Heart palpitations, no appetite whatsoever and nausea, but the worst by far was the anxiety. I would have four or five panic attacks a week just from tiny things like homework, and it drove me crazy. I ended up switching medications a couple months ago, and I'm doing much better now. These meds work great but DO NOT take them if you have a fast heart rate to begin with or are already prone to worrying/anxiety. 
232$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 8:24:04 AM$Reviewer: Onslo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Wonder drug ! I wish I had it when I was in school. I was labeled as a problem kid. Lazy,  always  in trouble. In the remedial classes in most subjects. Could not pay attention to things that were not interesting to me. Age 44 is when I was given my first dose of adderall. My kids were taking it for ADD. My doctor was treating me with anti depressants with no real results. He gave me a simple test to take in his office. Switched me to adderall to see if things in my life improved. With in just a few days I noticed Hugh improvements in my life. I was able to do things that I could never do before. Like understanding what I had just read, being able to focus on things that were always a challenge to me,so I avoided them. I could understand new concepts and enjoyed learning for the first time in my life. Before I struggled with following basic instructions and would get frustrated and just give up.  For me it was a new life that I could enjoy and be present and be part of things I was scared to get involved in. For fear that others would think I was slow or challenged. Adderall change my whole life for the better. I wonder where I would be today if I had been given this drug in my early school years. I own a very successfully catering business and I'm happy with my life. I will always wonder what I could have accomplished if I was given the right treatment when I was in school. 
233$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/26/2013 2:58:08 PM$Reviewer: Christine Tobey, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on Adderall for about 2 years nows due to a decrease in mental ability to what I call""  Mentally Keep Up"".  As a nurse working nights on a very busy floor that I truly Love & Self Employed Auto Dealership
column2: I became more & more scatter brained & stressed due to the inability to stay focused.  Adderall has made life so much better
column3: in that I can focus & get things done as I once did with out all the stress & un organized state of mind.  It has not caused me to have weight loss
column4: infact I have gained & maintain with difficulty to loose weight.  I sleep well when I do sleep & it is just such a miracle drug for me.  I notice when I have taken vacations from it
column5: I can not think for myself & I can NOT stay still long enough  when trying to sit at my desk to get work done.   I am very concerned about the ability to get COMPLETELY off this drug & function as I should.  Haven't got that far yet but will surely let you know when or if I do.   Important need of Adderral for me is that is slows me down MENTALLY so that I can properly function & think as I should in orders to focus & concentrate on very important & large amounts of work.  I was told by my doctor I was a TRUE canidate for this drug & I must agree.  I have Never been on any medication in my life.  This is the first & I am 51 years old.

249$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/20/2013 3:50:55 PM$Reviewer: head injury, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$Taking Adderall (generic)10mg 2st month and 20 mg 2nd month I begain losing my hair and my eyelashes were falling out (quite noticeable).  I stopped using it for a a couple of months (in between used ritalin [generic not as effective with focus and concentration] and my eyelashes grew back and my hair was not back to where it was before I started taking aderall but it stopped thinning, I was having nightmares and evil dreams, my eyes were so dried that I would wake up in pain in the middle of the night and have to put eye drops in, constipation, and racing thoughts.  I started taking the NAME BRAND Adderall a few months afterwards because I thought maybe the side effects were from the fillers because I am very sensitive to some medications.  I was able to concentrate and focus and become a normal person but again, slowly but surely, my eyelashes started to fall out and my eyes were dry but not as bad as on the generic brand--the dry eyes I could have tolerated, but I had to stop the Adderall or lose my hair on my head and eyelashes. Aside from the hair loss, I would have stayed on the NAME BRAND Adderall.  It was like I had chemotherapy and my hair was falling out.
250$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/14/2013 6:21:24 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$While I was initially skeptical of taking this medication because of my professional life (I'm an active-duty commissioned officer in the United States Air Force) I must admit that this mdication has changed my life. Not only was this medication life-changing, it only took hours for me to realize the bennifits of the treatment in terms of subsidence of my ADHD symptoms. While others have experienced problems with Adderall and its generic forms, I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND anyone suffering with serious, life-altering ADHD symptoms (as I was) consult your primary care physican or mental health care provider and see if this is an option for you. Believe me, I understand the challenges associated with both the stigma associated with ADHD generally and this medication specifically, but I promise that if this treatment is as effective for you as it was for me you'll kick yourself for waiting so long to try it (just like I did)!

258$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/28/2013 5:21:33 PM$Reviewer: [emailprotected], 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I was raised in a verbal
column2: physical
column3: sexual abused drug & alcohol addicted environment. My depression started at an early age. I had my first child on my 18th birthday & my second 18 months later. I had cervical cancer & had a partial hysterectomy @ age 26. In 2003 @ the age of 15 my only son was killed in a horrific alcohol related auto accident. My brother was the driver.

column1: I lost interest in everything.I lost everything.I cut myself off from even my best friend. I turned to drugs & alcohol(which I swore to NEVER do after the life I endured)for about 3 yrs. YES I wanted to die
column2: but never once thought of suicide. One day I just decided I had enough & quit all the nonsense. I did not seek help until 7 yrs after his death. I am now 43. Since I was a teen I noticed I had problems concentrating
column3: seeing things through to the end
column4: lack of interest. Daily headaches
column5: some leading to migraine. Multiple projects going at once. Occasional panic attacks & anxiety. I am so O.C.D. about certain things that I get on my own nerves. The panic attacks & anxiety have progressed over the years so I take xanax as well.  After trying several anti depressants that NEVER worked. & after seeing the results my daughter had with the Adderall
column6: I asked to try it. It has made such a difference in my life. I can actually concentrate long enough to complete what I start. I have found my passion for my art again. All this time & All the different medications I have tried
column7: people tell me it is a miracle cure for me & can attest to the fact that I feel like a NORMAL human being for once in my life..........I am extremely scared to death of this medication though.... I NEVER want to go back to whoever I was before Adderal Yet I don't want to become dependant on it & have to take it forever....rock & a hard place on this one...It is only thing I have found that actually works yet the aspect of the methamphetamine scares me. "

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Before getting diagnosed and taking medication
column3: my life was difficult and stressful.  I'm in graduate school and ever since I was younger I always had to study 2-4 times harder than everyone else just to get the same grade.  I was constantly losing everything
column4: forgetting what I had been doing
column5: and forgetting important things/events.  Now I've been taking a generic adderall and my life is so much easier.  I have spent less time studying and am finally able to organize things without getting distracted every 5 min.  Adderall is not good for everyone with ADHD and different treatments are available.  After my experience on medication
column6: I would recommend that people with ADHD at least try some sort of medication.  All of my friends who have ADD/ADHD take medication and are just fine.  There are some side effects
column7: but those are generally mild and go away after some time.  All in all
column8: adderall has helped me a lot in graduate school
column9: and I don't think I would be able to finish without it.

column1: 279$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/14/2012 8:34:46 PM$Reviewer: ps
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was prescribed Adderall three years ago and it has helped a great deal.  It helped alleviate probems such as chronic generalized anxiety
column3: panic attacks and bouts of depression (all disorders that physicians had been trying to ease with various prescriptions for years).  With Adderall
column4: I find myself simply pushing past the anxiety and panic. I have always been a perfectionist and this med does lend to occasional OCD
column5: but so far
column6: this has been managable.

column1: I have also had insomnia since I was a child and presently take Seroquel at bedtime so that I'm able to sleep. Prescribed sleeping pills have not worked. Since Seroquel is known for weight gain
column2: I have not enjoyed the weight loss I have heard others on Adderall describe.  I have recently tried Valerian Root and Melotonin with some positive results. Any other suggestions? Overall

column1: 284$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/8/2012 10:02:33 AM$Reviewer: rewindmind
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Adderall has helped me focus and actually complete a task or a 'to do' list. Can't believe what a difference it makes. My husband used to 'poo-poo' me...you are lazy
column3: just focus
column4: why can't you get anything done? I thought I was losing my mind. Was tested for ADD/ADHD by a psychiatric doctor who said I was anxious and depressed and prescribed Xanax....that made me sleepy and more disconnected.

column1: Finally found a nurse practitioner who recognized my symptoms right away. Sitting in her office
column2: I couldn't even keep my feet/legs still....always felt as if I needed to be doing something!! Within three days
column3: I couldn't believe the difference. I can focus at work
column4: I can listen to a conversation without having my mind race at all the 'things' I need to complete. Just wish I would have had this in college...a lot of my professors thought I was just a scatterbrain...

column1: One of the best commercials on TV was my ah-ha moment. A woman is sitting in a conference room--in a meeting with many others. The camera focuses on her face and she has thoughts racing through her mind
column2: the announcer says...""her mind is like a television that can't find the right channel"" shows constantly changing channels/commercials...Oh my...that is me...!! I knew I needed to find someone to help me. If this sounds like you...search until you find a health care provider that will listen. The first doc I saw
column3: made me think there was something seriously wrong with me
column4: even after all the ADHD tests. The Nurse Practitioner diagnosed me at the first visit.

column1: I have no issues with this medication
column2: no shaking or nervousness...the opposite effect actually. One complaint
column3: it is amphetamine  salts...there is a 'salty' taste in my mouth--occasionally. I drink lots of water during the day
column4: that seems to help. "

297$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/5/2012 3:36:05 AM$Reviewer: If I only knew, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$As a child I never really knew that i had a short attention span. I've always had a hard time in school, but I really noticed it whenever I got into college. No matter how much I studied I couldn't seem to retain any information. About a year ago I went to my doctor and found out I have ADD. I never knew I had it until I looked back at my childhood and all the way to me now as an adult. I was put on adderall 20mg twice a day my life actually became normal. For the first time in my life I actually heard a clock ticking while talking to family. My ability to stay focused and on task was just the best feeling in the world. My life has very organized and I can hold interest in studying, my work, as well as my social life. The only downfall about adderall was that it had an extreme supression of my appetite and I had no extra weight to lose. After I would come down off of my doseage I get very irritable, not sure if it's a side effect from the drug or the fact I work 3rd shift as a police officer and rarely sleep good. But overall this has been a blessing to me and my ability to do better at work and at home. If I only had this when I was a young kid and in school I believe my grades would have been out of this world!
298$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/3/2012 9:31:32 PM$Reviewer: sclark89, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$2$5$server heart burn
299$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/29/2012 7:36:03 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$I've been prescribed 20mg of Adderall IR 3 times daily since I was 15, and I'm almost 20 now. Up until a year ago, it helped A LOT. I suddenly got good grades, more social, and felt great about myself. This past year, I noticed it wasn't giving me the same awesome effects. So, I started taking half of one extra, for that extra boost. Half of one became 4. Yes, I was taking 7 to 8 a day. This went on for about 9 months. My seasonal depression turned into major depressive disorder and I'm diagnosed with general anxiety disorder, chronic insomnia, major depression, mild schizophrenia, and amphetamine psychosis. Moral of my story: If you enjoy becoming addicted to a drug, seeing and hearing stuff, paranoid, depressed, aggressive, and losing everyone close to you, go for it. For everyone else, DO NOT TRY/USE ADDERALL!!! And if you do, for god's sake, DO NOT ABUSE IT! YOU'LL BECOME MENTALLY CRAZY.
300$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/28/2012 1:01:43 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADD (not ADHD) in early August 2012 when I finally decided to get checked out for it
column2: and I'm taking 10mg twice daily. The pros: I am now less ""socially awkward""
column3: I'm more motivated and concentrated
column4: it boosts my mood (which is a HUGE plus considering I have chronic depression)
column5: I feel confident in my abilities to do things
column6: and I enjoy things I once never enjoyed
column7: which was just about everything. The cons: weight loss (I don't realize I'm not eating because it depletes your appetite)
column8: strange ""crawling""/ itching sensation when I begin to come down from it at night (anyone else with this sensation? It's not listed anywhere as far as side effects go)
column9: almost impossible to fall asleep at night if I take it too late in the day.

column1: Although the cons may seem like more than the pros
column2: the cons are very tolerable and can be relieves such as taking a non habit forming sleep aid (Zzzquil works great!) and if you absolutely aren't hungry while taking it
column3: drink an ensure shake once a day or take vitamins daily to ensure you don't become malnourished
column4: (butter pecan flavored ensure tastes pretty good). It also has a habit of causing your body to develop a tolerance
column5: so if you want to avoid taking massive doses in the future
column6: I recommend going a day or two (or three!) without taking it. Specifically on days where you don't have to accomplish anything. This (should) help prevent developing a tolerance and make sure that you get the full effect. Overall
column7: I am very
column8: VERY happy with this medication."

column1: 309$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/10/2012 12:50:58 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I've been taking Adderall for about 8yrs now and there's good news and bad news. Good news is that it works wonderfully in managing the symptoms. The bad news is that you have to watch how your appetite is affecting your eating habits
column2: usually you won't be hungry until the medicine wears off and you might find yourself malnourished if you're not careful. Also note that you can develop permanent 'tics' or compulsive repetitive behaviors. I have developed a tic of chewing on the side of my tongue. I am now pregnant and cannot take the medication for obvious reasons and yet I still chew on my tongue
column3: but that being said
column4: it isn't severe enough to prevent me from retaking it after my pregnancy because the ADHD is definitely worse than the side-effects of the Adderall. However
column5: every person is different so maybe for other people these 'tics' and appetite changes might not seem so minor. Overall though I have found it very useful and it has made a huge and mostly positive difference in my life
column6: so if you're thinking about trying it to treat your ADHD then I'd say go right ahead.

column1: 338$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/29/2012 2:55:31 PM$Reviewer: Kristy
column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been taking Adderall since I was in 3rd grade for treatment for my ADHD. I am now a junior in high school and still take it daily for school. When I started taking Adderall it was the 5mg IR before school every day. A very low dosage for an 8 year old but it did help. Since then I changed to 10 mg ER somewhere in later middle school when I was either 13 or 14. Just this year I increased to 20 mg ER before school with 10 mg IR after school in order to help focus on homework. The adderall has been invaluable for me in helping me focus both during school and out
column3: as well as lowering my impulsivity since it gives me that second reaction time before I say something or do something I shouldnt. The only side effect Ive ever noticed is that I do have a decrease of appetite when on the pill and once it wears off Im ravenously hungry. However
column4: once on the medication for 5 days or so that symptom has gone away and I end up hungry again. Overall I would recommend it to anyone with ADD or ADHD.

356$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/12/2012 1:14:38 PM$Reviewer: BreezieBoo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$To begin, I've never had an issue with addiction or drug abuse. I'm a college senior with a GPA of 3.6. I LOVE my classes and professors, but I can't pay attention as well as I wished. I found myself drinking insane amounts of coffee just to try and stay focused. I couldn't get through more than 4 pages in a book without having to reread it again. The worst part was, I had absolutely no motivation to do any schoolwork away from school (which used to not be a problem at all.) So, a few weeks ago, a classmate told me she was prescribed Adderall for the last 14 years, but stopped taking it, and selling it to make a quick buck. I had already researched ADD and ADHD and self diagnosed myself. I cut a 20mg pill in half, and didn't feel any difference at all. I waited a day or 2 and tried a full 20mg dose. 30 minutes later or so, I then found myself reading normally again, I was motivated to do things I had put off for weeks, I didn't get bored doing normal everyday things, and I didn't feel like I was moving at a million miles a minute (like I read people felt earlier.) I don't know when or if it even stopped working. I took it around 7pm and went to bed, no problem, at midnight (my typical bedtime) without any issues. I know that I don't HAVE to take it every day at all, but my days off when I want to just sleep and be lazy, I take  just ONE 20mg pill around noon after I have been up for a few hours, and I am far more productive than I have ever been in years. I'm not sure how to go about talking to a doctor about my self-diagnosis, or if there are any other similar medicines that could possibly be prescribed without the overly judged and criticized name Adderall attached to it. Not sure if that helps anyone, but I do see a positive change definitely. I wouldn't use it habitually or for an extended amount of time. 
357$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/10/2012 9:04:53 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$This helped me increase my focus and concentration tremendously... I once was at a standstill in College, always wanting class to be over, never paying attention, ditracted and over stimulated by the smallest noises; I would find myself obsessing about the tapping of a pencil, rather than the professor. As a result, my grades suffered, self-esteem suffered,  and I wanted to give up. I was prescribed adderall xr my sophomore year in College and I literally noticed a dramatic difference immediately. My grades went from a 2.4 and have remained at a 3.6. I do not recommend for long term use.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$"I get mixed feelings when it comes to Adderall. I'm a 25 y/o male that was diagnosed with ADHD 3 years ago. I took adderall (30mg
column3: 2x day) for the first 2 years and it worked well for the most part; there were two problems though. For one
column4: if you forget to take your second dose when you're supposed to
column5: you're going to notice...at least I did. Secondly
column6: god-forbid I took my morning dose on an empty stomach; I'd feel really jittery and my mind would race at 100mph. Overall though
column7: it did it's job. I ended up switching doctors at the VA (I'm a vet) and my new doc mentioned dexedrine. I was reluctant to try them
column8: but he put on me on 2x10mg spansules in the morning and 2x10mg tabs in the afternoon. Here I am a year later a lot happier with the results. The onset is smoother
column9: it's easier to eat on it and there are no ups-and-downs. I recommend looking into dexedrine for anyone who runs into these problems with adderall...Also
column10: dexedrine is a lot cheaper than adderall. Generic 10mg IR tabs cost about $.27 each
column11: while the 10mg spansules are 2.16each."

400$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/21/2011 3:38:36 AM$Reviewer: SpeedFiend, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have ADHD and I am prescribed 50mg vyvanse each day. It works well and I love it. Unfortunately, I love it so much I take well over the recommended daily dose. I have built my tolerance up to 350mg per day, and it makes me feel awesome. About a half hour after I pop them, my heart will start pounding and hurt incredibly. Often, when remaining still, my legs or arms will go numb. I feel dizzy and weak all the time. I will also get severe chest pain and back aches. I do not sleep, and if I do, I sleep at the most one hour during the day. Concerning eating habits, I don't eat much and have lost a lot of weight. My withdrawals are hell, and unexplainably miserable. I feel sad, tired, hungry, bored, and hopeless. I will admit that these pills possess most of my thoughts. If I don't have multiple pills on me at all times, I feel very uncomfortable. Therefore, I at least need to have pills on me for the next time I need to take some.

column1: 438$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/13/2011 10:03:55 AM$Reviewer: dtathomas
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I started Adderall-XR after my doctor ruled that I was ADHD
column3: which I was very reluctant to believe. I had a history of suicide attempts
column4: depression
column5: anxiety
column6: violence
column7: etc.
column8: which was attributed to a specific event  - being raped by our parish priest as a teenager at 13. The drug Adderall
column9: made it possible for me to be focused
column10: on task
column11: centered and a lot more accessible to psychological treatment which lasted almost 9 years. I am a much better person for doing the treatment
column12: I continue to take Adderall. It is the only ""psychological"" drug that I now take and was misdiagnosed for over 30 years. Work with your doctor to tweak this drug
column13: to the just right amount - you'll be glad you did. I am just one of the many that lived through a horrid
column14: tumultuous life in regards to the rape
column15: upbringing
column16: violence
column17: etc.
column18: and just trying to find the real me. A compassionate
column20: understanding and forgiving me buried deep under the ugly layers  of hell. I wrote a letter to my doctor and expressed the aforementioned and that he could read it to any patient that he desired - if he felt it would ""connect"" with that patient. My final words would be do not be afraid to ask questions
column22: get second opinions and never have blind allegiance to one doctor. We all make mistakes and are not perfect for we are truly
column23: only human - it is our nature. Anyone desiring to discuss what any medications have done for me were always welcome but you cannot base your results on someone else. You can only use it as a loose guideline for your own personal situation and physical makeup. That is where your trusted physician comes in and although they may be right on the money regarding one drug that works for you beware - they do not always remember all the drugs you are taking so that is where the patient must be vigilant
column24: especially when being referred from specialist to another doctor or specialist. I bring an up-to-date prescription printout to any new doctors as a new patient. Thank You -"

column1: 458$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/31/2011 12:21:17 PM$Reviewer: Eiheiken
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"This medication has helped my ADD tremendously especially in the work place. Some side effects though more so from coming off of it when I take drug holidays they are usually spent sleeping on the couch. When I take it though I do very well and usually by the end of the day sleeping is not a problem. However it used to be a problem when I took the XR version. Now I take the plain old fashion immediate release tablets 30mg at a time. Once in the morning and then in the afternoon or I break my afternoon in half to make an additional 15mg available to take closer to 4:00pm but no later that a way I can stretch it out if its a longer day. At this dosage/prescription I don't suffer from insomnia as the drug tends to wear off my quickly at the end of the day and then I can sleep. Some side effects like feeling speedy and shaky can happen but are usually mild if not somewhat pleasant anyhow. I've been taking this dosage for years and I still say there is an advantage to having ADD. One is being able to take Adderall as I can usually run circles around my co-workers. When I'm on my medicine its like my personality lights up a little more and I stay focused and on task with little negative side effects. After so many years my body is addicted to it though hence the major withdrawal I go through on the couch on drug holidays. But if you don't mind being lazy and sleepy during those time I think it is well worth it all. Adderall is 4 amphetamine salts in one tablet so its like the inventors of this drug just said to themselves ""well one of these stimulants has to hit the right spot"" and then they marketed it with the clever name ADD ERALL. So for what ever reason it does work well for ADD. The only other drug I haven't tried for ADD is Desoxyn (methamphetamine) I guess I have been afraid to even ask for it just by the stigma that goes along with the name. So my experience with these drugs is well worth mentioning if you want an honest and thorough review.   "

column1: 468$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/4/2011 8:13:02 PM$Reviewer: Nick
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"I am on Adderal XR. I began with 20 mgs and that worked for about three months. During this time I did not suffer from any side effects.But
column3: I began to feel ""out of it"" again and found myself struggling to focus and being overwhelmed with all my tasks. I also (again) had problems with impulsiveness and not being able to ""think clearly"". I asked my doctor for an increase and he then prescribed 30 mgs a day. It did help. I also discovered that the generic did not work for me. I am experiencing dry mouth as a side effect. With the medication I've estimated that it has decreased my impulsivity by 85%. I believe it has taken a years time and a bit more for me to see the maximum effect of the medication. It's as though my brain needed that much time to get ""soaked"" by the Adderall XR. I am now in the place where I am now starting to deal with developing good habits to overcome my great disorganization. I am trying to strengthen my ability to think linearly.  When I first started the medication (at 20 mgs and again at 30 mgs) I found disorganization unsettling and I became neater for a time.  I then again became sloppy and I was bothered by the fact that the sloppiness didn't seem to bother me. Over all I'm happy with the medication."

column2: Adderall (30mg/daily) has worked well for me. My academics have greatly improved and my ability to start
column3: continue
column4: and complete a task are a complete change. However
column5: like many others have said
column6: you quickly grow a tolerance to it. I have noticed an improvement with this by taking 1-2 days off a week. Those days are of course a little rough but the only thing that has helped me from the tolerance issues. I also have sleep apnea and if I'm having a rough day it sometimes makes me feel even more fatigued. The ""crashing"" after the medication begins to fade is sometimes worse then simply not taking it at all. So far the only medication I've tried for ADHD but overall a good medication thus far
column7: not sure If I'd say the same if used for sleep related disorders.

472$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2011 2:30:05 AM$Reviewer: wowthisstuffworks!, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I'm a college student majoring in electrical engineering and I was diagnosed with adhd when I was 12 years old: i was one angry and hyper kid! Anyways I was perscribed to Strattera as I entered middle school beginning with 20 mg. After seven years this medication was working miracles with a few ups and downs here and there... well that's the good part.
The bad news is the positive effects literally ""shut off"" in a matter of two weeks this past winter. I was back to that child who could barely read a couple of pages in a book
column2: let alone prepare for exams and papers as a college freshman. It was terrible: I lost great relationships with friends and family
column3: suffered from depression and constant unpredictable mood swings
column4: and the list goes on and on. Even with an increase in 80 mg the pills were useless unless two or more were consumed a day.

column1: I talked to my doctor about the problem and he said drastic neurochemical changes may have built a tolerance against the strattera
column2: which is farely common with that particular drug. To compensate
column3: he perscribed 20 mg of Adderall to take with 100 mg of Strattera a day
column4: and let me tell you
column5: the waters have settled and the sun shines again! Complete clarity and focus
column6: anxiety almost nonexistent
column7: and I feel back to my normal self. Only thing is that my appetite has diminished quite a bit and I have the libido of a neutered camel
column8: but those don't outweigh the fact that life is GREAT again. I could see where an addiction could transpire because it's pretty much altered cocaine that's approved by the fda
column9: but really it all comes down to you: ""can I survive w/o downing 16 pills today?"""

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$3$I was about 12 years old or so when I started taking Adderall. People said they noticed an immediate difference- my grades improved
column3: I started paying attention
column4: I was more obedient. Then
column5: by the time I turned 13
column6: I began to have chronic stomach pains
column7: which continue to plague me to this day. At the time
column8: I was battling ADD
column9: depression
column10: anxiety... you name it. The stomach issues were just another thing to add to the list. By age 15
column11: I had an endoscopy
column12: and it discovered I had a condition known as Eosinaphililic Esophagitis (I think that's how it's spelled) as well as an ulcer. I continued taking medicine to treat everything
column13: until I had the idea to just stop taking my medicine altogether. That was at age 16. For more than a year and a half
column14: I experienced NO pain whatsoever from my stomach
column15: my depression faded
column16: and I was still able to focus as well as I was able to on the drug. I haven't taken it since
column17: as I haven't felt a need to
column18: though I still take the stomach medicine as needed. Bottom line- Adderall interfered with many of the other drugs I was taking to treat other things
column19: and kept me in a state of perpetual pain. But I was always alert and focused
column21: the pill did its job. I don't see how everyone says this pill is addictive
column22: I find it far from that. During the time I was taking the medicine
column23: I continued to gain weight until I was nearly 300 pounds. Now
column24: it's been almost 2 years since I've taken them
column25: and the weight melted off naturally
column26: I'm down to 175- lighter than I've been in years. I feel better
column27: and I still can focus as well as I could on the drug
column28: despite not taking it. All in all
column29: I wouldn't really recommend taking this drug if you take other medicines in conjunction
column30: but it surely gets the job done if you don't mind the agony...

column1: 503$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/22/2011 11:44:05 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$1$3$"Whether or not you have ""ADD"" adderall will help you concentrate
column2: get things done
column3: be more efficient etc.. Im a Senior in college.. 95% of people use it to study. If your kid says this isn't true.. they are lying.. or a freshman.. or from Idaho. I was tested and given 20mg pills... at first it was amazing. Not only could I sit down studying for my exams for 10 hours straight (literally) but it felt fun to study. Class was all of a sudden so interesting. Loooong story short
column4: after a few months of using it off an on (about 3 pills a week) the effects changed. Yes
column5: I could concentrate better when I was alone studying/doing school work. However
column6: when taking adderall I felt like some kind of zombie. Like.. I couldn't smile couldn't laugh
column7: didn't want to talk to anyone..(Im usually very extroverted). The day after taking adderall I sleep until about 2 or 3 pm. Ew! Typically I wake up at 7am and cannot sleep past 9 am! Once you start using the drug it is hard to get off it. Example: I am not physically dependent but when HUGE exams come along I mentally feel like I NEEED adderall. And yes
column8: I use it. (Stopping after graduation in a week). The mind is a powerful thing. Once you get off the drug
column9: once simple tasks may seem laborious. Final point:: I wish I never tried it. Also... I agree with a comment right below.. it is so sad that children are given this drug. Crazy. Try changing their diet.. brain teasers.. holistic options! Im a psychology major and we were just learning how on a basic-level naturalists perspective.. kids are not supposed to have great concentration because its a time to explore as much as they can as their highly plastic brains develop. Although it has helped me focus on tasks and allowed me to complete projects without a problem it has also made me almost obsessed with whatever the task is that I am doing. For example
column3: I wanted to clean my pantry counter
column4: a quick spray with some cleaner and wipe it down
column5: no big deal right. About three hours later I realized I had cleaned the counter
column6: the stove inside and out
column7: the dishwasher
column8: sink
column9: floor
column10: and organized the cabinets. It felt as if I had to keep cleaning until everything was perfect and it just feels strange. Some may say that is a good thing but If I had video taped it I probably would of looked like a crazy person while doing it. Also
column11: I lost a good amount of weight since taking Adderal and now I feel I am to thin. I am 5'7"" and my weight was 155lbs before the Adderal
column12: I looked healthy. My weight went down to 132lbs and I looked sick but did manage over the last few months to get up to 145lbs. I take 50mg a day
column13: 30mg in the am and 20mg around noon. I have tried lowering the dose but it did absolutly nothing for me and without the second dose I end up crashing and want to nap by 2pm so the seond dose is basically to keep me going till bedtime. I do have trouble sleeping and even more trouble waking up but once I take my morning pill a half hour later I am good to go. Well that is my experience with Adderal so far
column14: oh yeah
column15: one more thing to add. I don't know if this happens to anyone else but I notice my hands and feet feel real cold at times and even though I will be sweating I am always cold. Well take care everyone

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I take 10mg twice daily
column3: once in the morning ~8-9am
column4: and again between 12 and 1pm. Have been doing so for about 6-7 yrs. Only other ADD med I've tried was Ritalin for a short time
column5: which didn't seem as helpful.  Pros: Improved focus
column6: concentration
column7: motivation for boring/difficult tasks.  Cons: Insomnia
column8: which is why I could not tolerate the extended release
column9: and must make sure not to take the 2nd dose later than about 1pm. A small dose of Trazadone (25-50mg) has helped with the insomnia. Does take away appetite temporarily
column10: but I make sure to force myself to eat adequately
column11: b/c if not I am left feeling ravenous at the end of the day when it is wearing off
column12: and have a headache and feel more moody than usual.  Need to take a 'drug holiday' at least 1 day each week
column13: or else the med starts to feel less effective.  I do tend to 'hyperfocus' on things that I shouldn't necessarily be focusing on at that given time
column14: but I'm not sure if this is just a symptom of ADD itself or a symptom exacerbated by the medication. Do see this as being addictive in terms of feeling the need to stay on it (though why would I NOT feel like I should stay on it
column15: as it is helpful for my ADD).  However have not ever felt the need for a higher dose.  May increase levels of anxiety
column16: if this is an underlying problem you already have. Has been helpful for ADD symptoms
column17: but I've also realized it is not a magic cure
column18: and cannot stress enough the importance of being proactive in terms of learning your individual weaknesses and trying different ways to help overcome them.  WebMD has been helpful
column19: along with www.ADDitude.com and www.ThriveWithADD.com.  Would love to meet with a psychotherapist that specializes in ADD
column20: but haven't been able to find such a thing.  A life coach specializing in ADD would also be great
column21: but unfortunately is not covered by insurance and seems to be quite costly.  Overall has been helpful for me
column22: but do believe that everyone is affected differently.  Good luck!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$1$4$"I took this drug from 2001 through 2010 and unfortunately never realized that this drug was the cause of intense calf pain and horrible circulation in my legs and hands. I even proactively asked the doctors if adderral could be causing the awful calf pain (which was the result of such poor circulation). The doctors all told me ""no"". FINALLY
column3: I found an incredible doctor who researched my pain extensively and told me that adderral may indeed be the cause of the freezing cold hands and feet
column4: as well as awful pain in my legs. Adderral is AWFUL to get off of. VERY DIFFICULT. I'm now off adderral and my pain is 90% better and I no longer have blue hands and feet. This drug can work wonders...but it has the potential to cause many health problems. "

column1: 531$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/7/2011 11:15:08 PM$Reviewer: Lionheart
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"This medication has its pros and cons. I've never been able to focus on anything for more than 30 minutes at most
column3: especially with work and school. It took a while to figure out what worked for me
column4: but due to insomnia I use the instant release tablets since they wear off by the end of the day. I take 15 to 30 mg per day and it works wonderfully. I feel like I can actually function like ""normal"" people. The downside is that this is a stimulant so it will wake you up and makes sleeping difficult. It also causes a loss of appetite
column5: which can be rather difficult to deal with. After taking a dose
column6: it becomes nearly impossible to eat. Even forcing food down with liquids is a chore. It's as if food has no appeal or satisfying taste. Another negative side-effect of the instant release tablets is the comedown. Since this is a stimulant similar to speed/cocaine/meth
column7: it can have an intense comedown. I become very easily agitated (little things will set me off)
column8: I get headaches
column9: and I overall just feel sick. This is more intense if you haven't been eating throughout the day and if your taking a higher dose. Being aware of how crappy the comedown is makes it easier to deal with. I now can control my mood very well during my comedown and it now rarely affects me. I am not recommending this since it is an illegal solution (unless you have a medical prescription)
column10: but ""herbal"" use has been extremely helpful with the side-effects. Once my day is over and my comedown is beginning to make me feel sick
column11: a little greenery goes a long way. It removes all the negative moods and headaches
column12: restores my appetite
column13: and helps me fall asleep. I can not believe such a helpful drug is illegal
column14: because I would be (more) underweight and sick without it. It's what works for me and my prescribing psychiatrist is aware of my use
column15: but I'm not here to preach about it.

column1: Basically
column2: Adderall side-effects can be ROUGH
column3: but without it I could never manage to work 8 hour days or sit through night class."

540$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/16/2011 5:20:20 PM$Reviewer: Shyboi30
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$2$1$I'm a 30 year old white male who is a recovering addict from meth. I'm diagnosed with ADD w\o Hyperactivity. My life has been a stuggle. I lived with this disorder untreated for most of my life. this is how I found my way to meth addiction before I found out my real problem.  I want everyone to know that this medication is nothing like meth. A lot of people say that it is and a lot of people believe that it is. Let me
column3: being someone who has experienced both. Tell you that it is not at all the same.  To be honest with you I wish that it was. Do not think that in anyway I'm trying to say that meth is a good drug in anyway. What I'm saying is
column4: is that meth for people with ADD is a form of self medication and its addicting to us because we become normal people. I had high hopes that this medication would have some of the positive results that meth offers and none of the negative attributes of that drug.  I'm pretty sure I can tell you why this medication is addictive to people though. I've been on a lot of different medications and have learned well how to evaluate their effect on my life. This medication is the most difficult to figure out dosage and the most inconsistent medication I have ever dealt with. This medication can be addicting for us because we are tired of living our lives with ADD. When you take the medication and get varied and inconsistent results you want positive results so you take more to try to find that place where it helps you and remains effective. Its not a medication that you can just take the dosage when your supposed to and it will do what its supposed to. So far I'm not pleased with adderall. I will probably ask my doctor for something else on my next visit and pray that something else will work better for me. I know that this medication helps some people and I really wish that I was getting those kind of results. It would be nice to be able to speak with other people taking this medication and see what their experience has been like.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$1$4$I have taken adderall for about 8 years now.  I have some mixed feelings about it.  I would not recomend it because of soo many mood swings
column3: and it is very addictive.  It really helps me like the hour after i take it and after that i feel tired and disinterested and not in a real good mood.  It also made me lose my appatite in the mourning and I would have to force me to eat then later on in the afternoon I would be starved cause i hadn't ate much earlier because the pills made me not hungry.  This stuff did calm me down to some extent but I became a whole different person when I was on this and it changed my personality and that was not a good thing.  My grades in school did greatly improve on this stuff.  And it does work immediatly when I take it.  I also noticed though when I took this it made me focus but made me focus on things I shouldn't be focused on.  This makes you feel awake when you first take it then like right after lunch time you feel completly ezhausted and you can't focus on anything
column4: plus i would get headaches every day.  This stuff did temperaily put you in a real good mood like 15 min after you take it then all the sudden you were in a bad mood.  This stuff works great for like a couple years
column5: then after a while you feel addicted to this drug and like it consumes your life.  There are too many ups and downs with this and a different moods every hour.  And without this drug I am not a moodie guy at all.  So I would not reccomend this stuff at all.  This stuff will mess you up.  Try Ritlen I took it for a while it seemed a bit better.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$5$5$5$I have been on the generic adderall for about 4 months now 20mgs 2xday. column3: now i stay more focused on my diet and exercise. And i have helpped many people around me with health issues and to get closer to God. It has helpped me so much. i wish now that my parents would of not been so against ADHD meds. when i was a kid i had a lot of trouble in school. I got alot of help from the teachers they would read my test to me so i could hear it and see it at the same time. I know now that i would of got better grades and not suffered so much if my parents would of not jugded everything by what they hear on the news about kids beating up kids for retalin on the bus. It has worked wonders and i dont plan on taking it my whole life it just has helpped me get my lifed turned around. I have always loved to make people smile with the dorky little things and sound effects i make just for fun and i know you make awesome sound effects to if you have the same prob:) I have not lost my wonderful personality. I am very greatful for the chance to get my life on track for once and not be lost in lifes smallest things anymore.
